DataElement.preferredName: Disease or Disorder Diagnosis Source OMOP CDM Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.:The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation._Where something is available or from where it originates._A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.:The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation._Where something is available or from where it originates._A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.:The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation._Where something is available or from where it originates.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown.

Concepts.definition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.preferredDefinition: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation._Where something is available or from where it originates.

Concepts.definition: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.
Where something is available or from where it originates.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

ValueDomain.preferredName: OMOP Common Data Model Diagnosis Source Code
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An open community data standard, designed to standardize the structure and content of observational data and to enable efficient analyses that can produce reliable evidence._The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation._Where something is available or from where it originates._A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The act of admitting a patient into a hospital for evaluation and/or treatment._The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

Concepts.definition: The act of admitting a patient into a hospital for evaluation and/or treatment.

The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The circumstance or condition that results in the death of a living being.

Concepts.definition: The circumstance or condition that results in the death of a living being.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Condition to be Diagnosed by Procedure
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A condition that will be diagnosed based on a procedure that has been ordered.

Concepts.longName: Condition to be Diagnosed by Procedure
Concepts.definition: A condition that will be diagnosed based on a procedure that has been ordered.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Having been established or verified.: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

Concepts.definition: Having been established or verified.

The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A significant condition that is neither the immediate, intervening, originating, nor underlying cause of death but which contributed to the fatal outcome.

Concepts.definition: A significant condition that is neither the immediate, intervening, originating, nor underlying cause of death but which contributed to the fatal outcome.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The release of a patient from a course of care._The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

Concepts.definition: The release of a patient from a course of care.

The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The final disease, injury, or complication directly causing a death.

Concepts.definition: The final disease, injury, or complication directly causing a death.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The diagnosis or diagnoses discovered or confirmed during a surgery.

Concepts.definition: The diagnosis or diagnoses discovered or confirmed during a surgery.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An initial diagnosis that is subject to change as new information becomes available.

Concepts.definition: An initial diagnosis that is subject to change as new information becomes available.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A diagnosis made on the basis of signs, symptoms, and testing and indicating the need for surgery.

Concepts.definition: A diagnosis made on the basis of signs, symptoms, and testing and indicating the need for surgery.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The diagnosis that describes the main reason for the patient's admission to the hospital.

Concepts.definition: The diagnosis that describes the main reason for the patient's admission to the hospital.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The patient's condition which is the main reason for evaluation and treatment.

Concepts.definition: The patient's condition which is the main reason for evaluation and treatment.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The primary condition for which a patient was treated as noted at the time of discharge from the hospital.

Concepts.definition: The primary condition for which a patient was treated as noted at the time of discharge from the hospital.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The primary condition for which a patient is being sent for a referral.

Concepts.definition: The primary condition for which a patient is being sent for a referral.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A referral to another physician for a diagnosis.

Concepts.definition: A referral to another physician for a diagnosis.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A means of finding a solution to a problem, or a means of finding agreement or harmony._A state of being, such as a state of health.

Concepts.definition: A means of finding a solution to a problem, or a means of finding agreement or harmony.
A state of being, such as a state of health.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Derived as a result of a primary condition; not direct or immediate; of second rank or importance or value._The act of admitting a patient into a hospital for evaluation and/or treatment.

Concepts.definition: Derived as a result of a primary condition; not direct or immediate; of second rank or importance or value.
The act of admitting a patient into a hospital for evaluation and/or treatment.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A condition that coexists with the patient's primary reason for treatment.

Concepts.definition: A condition that coexists with the patient's primary reason for treatment.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A coexisting condition noted at the time of a patient's discharge.

Concepts.definition: A coexisting condition noted at the time of a patient's discharge.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A coexisting condition for which a patient is being sent for a referral.

Concepts.definition: A coexisting condition for which a patient is being sent for a referral.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The disease or injury that initiated the chain of events leading directly to death, or the circumstances of the accident or violence which produced the fatal injury.

Concepts.definition: The disease or injury that initiated the chain of events leading directly to death, or the circumstances of the accident or violence which produced the fatal injury.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The circumstance or condition that results in the death of a living being.

Concepts.definition: The circumstance or condition that results in the death of a living being.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).
